text:
JUST RECEIVED

A large and complete stock of

New Spring Goods,

Which we are offering very cheap.

To make room for our Cumberland freight, expected shortly.

STAPLE & FANCY DRY GOODS

All the Latest Novelties.

NEW Spring & Summer Goods

Our Stock in this line is very complete, and prices will be found very low.

Mens' Shoes from $1.25.
Ladies' Newport Tie Shoe $1.50

Clothing,

A choice assortment of Ready Made Clothing.

Mens' Fancy Shirts in great variety.

HATS,

Felt Hats in all styles.

Groceries,

We show the largest stock of Groceries and Confectionery ever imported.

Armour's Celebrated Sugar Curled Hams, 30 cents per lb.

TO THE ELECTORS OF THE Electoral District of LORNE

Gentlemen—

Having been requested by a number of friends to offer myself as a Candidate for the coming Election, I beg respectfully to inform you that I am determined to come, and if returned, I pledge myself to do all in my power to further the interests of Prince Albert and vicinity.

Yours obediently,

J. M. Campbell.

James O'Brien & Co.,

30 College Street, Montreal.

WHOLESALE CLOTHING.

James O'Brien & Co.,

Princess Street, Winnipeg.
Notice to Creditors.

In the Goods of Alexander Rederick Kennedy, deceased.

Notice is hereby given that all bills, notes and other obligations, contracts, agreements and papers of every kind made by or under Alexander Rederick Kennedy, late of Prince Albert, in the North West Territories, Canada, and all other matters connected therewith, due on the thirteenth day of January, A.D. 1863, and thereafter, are hereby declared to be due and payable at once, and that the same may be paid by sending the same to the undersigned, who will be responsible for the same.

J. SINCLAIR,
Merchant Tailor.

PRINCE ALBERT, N.W.T.

WHOLESALE ONLY.

Between Pemberton and Ramattayne Streets.

WINNIPEG.

NOTICE.

To Merchants and Others.

PARTIES WHO REQUIRE

Accounts collected or Business Books kept up, cap. but. charged, etc.

Will be supplied at reasonable prices by the undersigned.

A. R. BURNS.

J. L. JOHNSON & CO.

STOBART, EDEN & CO.,

General Merchants AND Indian Traders,

PRINCE ALBERT, N.W.T.

FARMERS' NOTICE.

A HARRIS, SON & CO.

Have delivered to the undersigned a complete number of Ploughs and Harrows.

R. J. O'LEARY,

NOTICE.

To Merchants:

Freighters will be required to show Shipping Bills and an Order before your freight will be delivered to them.

Respectfully,

AGENT, C.P.R.

THE ECHO HOUSE,

QUAPPPELLE.

The favorite resort of all visitors to the Quappelle, and the only place where they can be accommodated in the most comfortable manner.

C. MAIR,

P.O. DRAWER 4,

Prince Albert, N.W.T.

Real Estate FOR SALE—A NUMBER OF CHOICE BUILDING LOTS CENTRALLY LOCATED IN PRINCE ALBERT

And suitable for business purposes or private residences. Further particulars apply by letter or telegram.

S. H. CASWELL.

ASH & ROBBINS.
PRINCE ALBERT, N.W.T.
FARMING LANDS!
FOR SALE IN
Manitoba & North-west
The Hudson's Bay Company own 700,000 acres in the Grass Lands Belt, and now offer for sale 300,000 acres, already surveyed by the Government of Canada.
ALSO
TOWN LOTS
FOR SALE
In Winnipeg, West Lynne, Rat Portage, Portage la Prairie and Gooseham, N.W.T.
The above will be disposed of at reasonable prices and on easy terms of payment.
Full information in regard to these lands will be given at the offices of the Company in Winnipeg and Montreal.

J. O. DAVIS & CO.,
PRINCE ALBERT, N.W.T.
